intro: Didymocarpus rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leafed didymocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its rounded, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, woody fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural gardens.
